intro: Tontelea scabra, commonly known as the rough tontelea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive texture. Tontelea scabra is often found in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat.
